events.title: Sack of Rome
events.description: Troops of Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor, sack Rome, marking a crucial event in the Italian Wars and the decline of the Renaissance in Rome.
events.significance: Marked a significant shift in European power dynamics and resulted in widespread destruction and loss of life.

events.title: Dr. William Morton Demonstrates Ether Anesthesia
events.description: Dr. William Morton publicly demonstrates the use of ether as an anesthetic during surgery at Massachusetts General Hospital.
events.significance: A major milestone in medical history that revolutionized surgery and pain management.

events.title: Our Lady of Fátima Apparitions Begin
events.description: Three shepherd children in Fátima, Portugal, report witnessing apparitions of the Virgin Mary, sparking a major religious pilgrimage site.
events.significance: Led to the establishment of Fátima as a key site of Catholic devotion and influenced religious thought and practices.

events.title: The Blitz Begins
events.description: The German Luftwaffe begins bombing London and other British cities during World War II in a campaign known as the Blitz.
events.significance: Marked a significant phase in WWII, affecting civilian populations and British morale.

events.title: Pope John Paul II Assassination Attempt
events.description: Pope John Paul II survives an assassination attempt in St. Peter's Square in Vatican City.
events.significance: Had profound effects on the Pope's papacy and international relations, highlighting issues of security and political violence.
